abstract: Tells the delegate that the app is now active.

# applicationDidBecomeActive(_:)

**Instance Method**

Tells the delegate that the app is now active.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func applicationDidBecomeActive(_ notification: Notification)
```

## Parameters

- **notification**: A notification named [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/didBecomeActiveNotification]. Calling the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/object] method of this notification returns the `NSApplication` object itself.

## Related Documentation

- **applicationDidFinishLaunching(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the app’s initialization is complete but it hasn’t received its first event.

## Managing Active Status

- **applicationWillBecomeActive(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the app is about to become active.
- **applicationWillResignActive(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the app is about to become inactive and will lose focus.
- **applicationDidResignActive(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the app is no longer active and doesn’t have focus.
